Welcome to MATCHER’s documentation!¶

Contents:

class matcher.MATCHER(X, missing_data=True)[source]¶

Manifold Alignment to Characterize Experimental Relationships (MATCHER)

Parameters:
  • X (list, possibly nested) – One or more single cell datasets. To learn a joint trajectory from two datasets with known correspondences, add a second level list.
  • missing_data (bool) – Model missing data?
correlation(model1, model2, inds1, inds2)[source]¶

Approximate correlation between the specified features of two different data types.

Parameters:
  • model1 (int) – Index of first data type
  • model2 (int) – Index of second data type
  • inds1 (list) – Indices of features
  • inds2 (list) – Indices of features
Returns:

Spearman correlation matrix and p-values
Rytpe:

list of arrays
find_markers(inds, fdr_correction=True)[source]¶

Find features that are significantly related to pseudotime from each specified data type.

Parameters:
  • inds (list) – Indices of data types to use
  • fdr_correction (bool) – Perform multiple hypothesis test correction to control FDR?
Returns:

list of indices for each data type
Return type:

list of lists
infer(quantiles=10)[source]¶

Infer pseudotime values using variational Bayes.

Parameters:quantiles (int) – How many quantiles to use when computing warp functions
plot_feature(model_ind, feature_ind)[source]¶

Plot the specified feature and its model fit

Parameters:
  • model_ind (int) – Index for data type
  • feature_ind (int) – Index of feature
plot_pseudotime(inds)[source]¶

Plot inferred pseudotime values and posterior uncertainty for models specified by inds.

Parameters:inds (list) – Indices of data types
plot_warping_functions(inds)[source]¶

Plot the functions for each data type that map from “domain-specific pseudotime” to “master pseudotime”.

Parameters:inds (list) – Indices of data types
reverse_pseudotime(inds)[source]¶

Reverse the direction of pseudotime for the specified model(s). This handles the case when the trajectories from different data types move in opposite directions.

Parameters:inds (list) – Indices of the model(s) to reverse
sample_pseudotime(ind, samples=10)[source]¶

Sample from the posterior for the inferred pseudotime values for the specified model.

Parameters:
  • ind (int) – Index of model to sample
  • samples (int) – Number of samples
Returns:

Posterior samples from inferred pseudotime values for each cell
Return type:

SxN array, where S is the number of samples and N is the number of cells
